TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Legend extends System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartNamedElement

Docs.summary: Represents the legend for the chart image.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend> class encapsulates all the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control's legend, and is exposed using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Legends%2A> collection property of the root <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> object.
There can be any number of legends for a chart image.
Legends can:
- Be docked and aligned.
- Be displayed inside or outside the plotted chart areas.
- Automatically fit their contents.
- Use a predefined style, such as row, column or table.
- Use hatching, gradient colors and background images.
- Be sized and positioned anywhere within the chart image.
Legend items are represented by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendItem> object, and are either default or custom items. Custom items are not associated with data, and can be added, deleted and modified using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.CustomItems%2A> property.
Default items are by default automatically added to the legend, and are the names of the plotted data points for doughnut and pie charts.
For all other chart types, the default items are the names of the plotted data series. Each series has a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.Legend%2A> property that defines the name of the legend that will be used. A legend item will not be created for a series if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCustomProperties.IsVisibleInLegend%2A> property is set to `false`. The text for these default items can be changed using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCustomProperties.LegendText%2A> property. This property will allow you to specify predefined keywords that will be replaced by their appropriate values at run-time.
If you have a pie chart and you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCustomProperties.Label%2A> property, it will also set the legend text to the value you set for the labels. If you want to set the text to a different value, you can set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCustomProperties.LegendText%2A> property. In most cases, you would want to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCustomProperties.LegendText%2A> property to "#AXISLABEL" or "#VALX".
Legend series symbols are rectangles, dots or lines. The symbol type is set automatically by the chart and depends on the plotted chart type.
Legend text by default is automatically sized. You can disable automatic sizing of legend text by disabling the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.IsTextAutoFit%2A> property. When this property is set to `false`, the size of the legend text is determined by the Size property of the legend <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.Font%2A>. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.IsTextAutoFit%2A> property is enabled, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.AutoFitMinFontSize%2A> property determines the minimum font size that a legend item can have when resizing.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.TextWrapThreshold%2A> property defines a limit on the number of characters that can be shown on one line before text is wrapped to another line. If you do not wish to wrap text in the legend, set the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.TextWrapThreshold%2A> property to zero. By default, when the entire legend text does not fit in the legend, the text will be truncated. You can set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.TextWrapThreshold%2A> on the legend to get the text to wrap instead of being truncated.
If the contents of the legend cannot fit into the given space, legend entries are truncated. An ellipsis is shown to indicate that there are more entries than the legend has space for. To prevent the legend items from being truncated, set the position and size of the legend using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.Position%2A> property. When setting the legend position or size, the chart can no longer automatically position the elements in the chart. In some cases, you many need to manually position other chart elements to achieve the desired appearance.
Another option would be to define your own cell columns instead of using the default legend settings.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend> object has a CellColumn Collection; each CellColumn object represents a column in the Legend. A cell column has <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumn.MaximumWidth%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumn.MinimumWidth%2A> properties that can be used to adjust the size of the columns.
When the legend contains many entries, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.InterlacedRows%2A> can be used to improve readability. When this property is set to True, it will display a back color that you can set using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.InterlacedRowsColor%2A> property.
By default, the legend is positioned in the top-right corner of the chart. This position can be modified by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.Docking%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.Alignment%2A> properties of the legend. The legend can also be associated with a chart area by use of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.DockedToChartArea%2A> property. This property specifies the name of the chart area for which the legend should be docked. In addition, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> property can be used to display the legend inside a chart area.
When <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> is set to False, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.MaximumAutoSize%2A> property defines the maximum size, in percent, of the legend within the available chart when the legend is automatically positioned. This property should be set if you wish to adjust the width or height of the legend after the docking properties have been set.
The legend can be modified using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.CustomizeLegend> event.

member this.Alignment : System.Drawing.StringAlignment with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the legend.
Docs.value: A .NET Framework enumeration value that represents the alignment of the legend. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The legend can be aligned so that it is <xref:System.Drawing.StringAlignment.Near>, <xref:System.Drawing.StringAlignment.Center> or <xref:System.Drawing.StringAlignment.Far>; its alignment is also affected by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.Docking%2A> property setting.
If the legend is docked to the top or bottom, <xref:System.Drawing.StringAlignment.Near> is to the left; if it is docked to the left or right, <xref:System.Drawing.StringAlignment.Near> is at the top. The <xref:System.Drawing.StringAlignment.Far> property setting is just the opposite, and aligns the legend to the right or the bottom, depending on where it is docked.
<xref:System.Drawing.StringAlignment.Center> always centers the legend, either vertically or horizontally.
Setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.Alignment%2A> property will have no effect if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.Position%2A> property is not set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition.Auto%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the background color of a legend.
Docs.value: A value that represents the background color of a legend. The default color is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can set this property to any valid ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) value.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackColor%2A> value will be the first color used if you have specified gradient colors for the background.
The alpha value controls the opacity of a color. If you set this color to "transparent" - that is, if you use an alpha value of 0 - no color will be assigned to the background of the legend. As a result, the background will be transparent.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::GradientStyle BackGradientStyle { System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::GradientStyle get(); void set(System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::GradientStyle value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Web.UI.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.GradientEditor, System.Web.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")
get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the orientation for the background gradient of a legend. Also determines whether a gradient is used.
Docs.value: A enumeration that represents the orientation for the background gradient of a legend. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackGradientStyle%2A> property to determine whether a legend will display a gradient, and to determine the orientation of the gradient if one is used.
For a listing of available patterns, refer to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.GradientStyle> enumeration.
To use gradient colors:
Set the primary color of the legend background with the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackColor%2A> property.
Set the secondary color of the legend background with the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property.
Set this <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackGradientStyle%2A> property to the desired gradient style.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::ChartHatchStyle BackHatchStyle { System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::ChartHatchStyle get(); void set(System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::ChartHatchStyle value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Web.UI.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.HatchStyleEditor, System.Web.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the hatching style of a legend.
Docs.value: A enumeration that represents the hatching style of a legend. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartHatchStyle> enumeration specifies the hatch pattern used by a brush of type <xref:System.Drawing.Drawing2D.HatchBrush>. The hatch pattern consists of a solid background color and lines drawn over the background.
For a listing of available hatching styles, refer to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartHatchStyle> enumeration.
**Note** The color of hatching lines is determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the background image of a legend.
Docs.value: A value that represents the URL of an image file. The default value is an empty string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property defines a path to a background image for a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> legend, and can be an absolute or relative URL.
To position the image, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackImageAlignment%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackImageWrapMode%2A> properties.
You can also specify one of the colors displayed by the image as "transparent", by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackImageTransparentColor%2A> property.
An image can originate from any valid graphics file supported by .NET Framework, including icons.
Background images take precedence over other background properties such as gradient color.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::ChartImageWrapMode BackImageWrapMode { System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::ChartImageWrapMode get(); void set(System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::ChartImageWrapMode value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the drawing mode of a legend background image.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that represents the drawing mode of a legend background image. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackImageWrapMode%2A> property determines how the image is displayed; the image can be tiled, scaled, and so forth.
If an image is scaled, it will be stretched to fit within the bounds of the legend. If the image is tiled, it is repeatedly drawn, starting from the top-left corner of the legend.
For more information about the available wrapping modes, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode> enumeration topic.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackImageWrapMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode.Unscaled>, the location where the image is drawn is determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackImageAlignment%2A> property setting.

get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the secondary color of a legend background.
Docs.value: A value used for the secondary color of background with hatching or gradient fill. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property determines the secondary background color of many <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> objects, and is used when gradient colors are being applied.
You can set <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackSecondaryColor%2A> to any valid ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) value.
If hatching is used, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property determines the color of the hatching lines for the legend.
To use gradient colors for the background of a legend:
- Set the primary color with the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackColor%2A> property.
- Set the secondary color with the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property.
- Set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackGradientStyle%2A> property to the desired gradient style.

For other border styles, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartDashStyle> enumeration topic.

Docs.summary: Gets a object used for custom legend items.
Docs.value: A object used for custom legend items.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This collection property can be used to add, delete or modify custom legend items.
Custom legend items, unlike default legend items, do not have associated series or data points.
To modify legend items, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.CustomizeLegend> event.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::Docking Docking { System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::Docking get(); void set(System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::Docking value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines where the legend is docked.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that determines where the legend is docked. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend> can be docked to the top, left, bottom or right of either the entire chart image, or the inside or outside of a chart area. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> property is set to `false`, docking applies to the entire chart image. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> property is set to `true`, docking applies to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.DockedToChartArea%2A> property
This property has no effect if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.Position%2A> property is not set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition.Auto%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a object, which is used to set font properties of the legend.
Docs.value: A object which is used to set font properties of the legend.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you attempt to change the properties of this <xref:System.Drawing.Font> object at run time, a compilation error will occur. To set font properties at run time, you must create a new <xref:System.Drawing.Font> object.
> [!NOTE] > If you set the Legend.Font.Size property, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.IsTextAutoFit%2A> property will be set to false. Also, if you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.IsTextAutoFit%2A> property to true, this property will be reset to its default, which is 8 points.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag that indicates if legend rows will be drawn with interlaced background color.
Docs.value: A value that determines whether alternating rows in the legend are drawn with a specified color.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the legend contains many entries, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.InterlacedRows%2A> property can be used to improve readability. When this property is set to `true`, the legend will display a background color for the rows that are interlaced, which can be set using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.InterlacedRowsColor%2A> property.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag that indicates whether the legend is docked inside or outside the chart area.
Docs.value: if the legend is docked inside the chart area; if it is docked outside the chart area. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property will only have an effect if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.DockedToChartArea%2A> property is set to the name of a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object.
> [!NOTE] > If the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.Position%2A> property is set to any value other than <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition.Auto%2A>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> property also has no effect. This is because the position of the legend is determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.Position%2A> property setting.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag that specifies the order in which legend items are displayed. This property only affects legend items automatically added for the chart series; it has no effect on custom legend items.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that specifies the order in which legend items are displayed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendItemOrder> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendItemOrder.Auto>, the legend will automatically be reversed if StackedColumn, StackedColumn100, StackedArea or StackedArea100 chart types are used.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::LegendStyle LegendStyle { System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::LegendStyle get(); void set(System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::LegendStyle value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the style of the legend.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that determines the legend style. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, the legend is displayed as a series of items in a table. You can specify whether to expand items in the table width-wise or height-wise by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.TableStyle%2A> property. When the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.TableStyle%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendTableStyle.Auto>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control will determine whether to draw a wide table or a tall table, depending on the alignment and positioning of the chart. This may cause the legend to be drawn using multiple legend item columns.
There are three possible styles for a legend: Column, Row and Table. Refer to the table below for a summary of these styles:
|Style|Description| |-|-| |Column|Legend items are displayed in one column, with multiple rows. Most commonly used when the legend is docked to the left or right of the chart.| |Row|Legend items are displayed in one row, with multiple columns. Most commonly used when the legend is docked to the top or bottom of the chart.| |Table|Legend items are displayed using multiple columns and rows.|

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float MaximumAutoSize { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.MaximumAutoSize : single with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of the legend, measured as a percentage of the chart area. This value is used by the automatic layout algorithm.
Docs.value: A value that represents the maximum size of the legend.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the legend is docked to the left or right of the chart area, this property determines the maximum width of the legend, which is measured as a percentage of the chart area. If the legend is docked to the top or bottom, this property determines the maximum height of the legend, which is also measured as a percentage.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::ElementPosition ^ Position { System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::ElementPosition ^ get(); void set(System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::ElementPosition ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an object, which can be used to get or set the position of the legend.
Docs.value: An value that represents the position of the legend. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.Position%2A> property is automatic (that is, Legend.Position.Auto = `true`) the legend position is calculated automatically by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control, taking into account the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.Docking%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.Alignment%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> property settings.
If it is not automatic, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.Docking%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.DockedToChartArea%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> properties are ignored, and the legend position is solely determined by the value of the returned <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition> object.

get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the shadow color of the legend.
Docs.value: A value that represents the shadow color of the legend. The default color is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property can be set to any valid ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) value.
The alpha value can be used to achieve a "realistic" shadowing effect; try a color value of "128,0,0,0" for shadows.
To implement a shadow, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.ShadowOffset%2A> property to a value other than zero (0).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int ShadowOffset { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.ShadowOffset : int with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the shadow offset, in pixels, of the legend.
Docs.value: An value that represents the shadow offset, in pixels, of the legend.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To implement shadowing, set this property to a value other than zero (0). A positive value will result in a shadow that shifts down and to the right; a negative value will result in a shadow that shifts up and to the left.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is only applicable if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.LegendStyle%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendStyle.Table>.

member this.TextWrapThreshold : int with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of characters that can be sequentially displayed in the legend before the text is wrapped.
Docs.value: An value that represents the number of characters that can be placed in the legend sequentially before the text is wrapped. The default value is 25.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the legend text exceeds the value specified by this property, text will be automatically wrapped when the next white-space character is encountered. Text will not be wrapped if there are no white-space characters in the text.
Set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.TextWrapThreshold%2A> property to zero to disable the feature.
